ks.framework.common
Class Message

java.lang.Object
  ks.framework.common.Message
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Wrapper class for an XML Document that conforms to the ks.xsd schema defined at http://www.wpi.edu/~heineman/xml.

The full set of commands, requests and adminCommands can be found at http://www.wpi.edu/~heineman/xml.

One could envision writing a series of subclasses, each representing the different types of messages, requests and adminCommands. For now, however, I am taking the lightweight approach and expecting that the user of this class will be able to do the requisite XML parsing to retrieve the desired information.

Every Message is from a specific user and is intended to be sent to a specific user. If the message is to be broadcast, then it can be so marked. A message can be marked as Local. This implies that it will not be distributed over the network, but rather handled by local processing.

A Message is serializable to ensure transport over the network.

Author:
George Heineman
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

contentsChild

public org.w3c.dom.Node contentsChild()
If the contents node has an Element child, this fetches the first Node object and returns it. The first child is the actual command, request or admin-command

Returns:
Node which represents command, request or admin-command.

construct

public static org.w3c.dom.Document construct(java.lang.String contents)
Return Document object that contains the Message as scanned.

Make method synchronized since parse() is not thread safe. Thus we ensure serialized access to the parsing routines.

Parameters:
contents - the XML fragment to be encapsulated within a Message.
Returns:
Document object representing the Message.
